snippet: Explosions in two major cities are further signs that rebels fighting to topple President Bashar al-Assad are shifting tactics.
abstract: Explosions in two major Syrian cities, Aleppo and Damascus, leave at least three people dead; blasts appear to be a further sign that rebels fighting to topple Pres Bashar al-Assad are shifting tactics toward homemade explosives.
lead_paragraph: Explosions in two major cities are further signs that rebels fighting to topple President Bashar al-Assad are shifting tactics.

headline.main: Explosions Hit Major Syrian Cities, Leaving at Least 3 Dead
headline.print_headline: Explosions Hit Major Syrian Cities, Leaving at Least 3 Dead
